thread.title: Doha Bank says backing loan for $604m reservoirs scheme
thread.title_full: Doha Bank says backing loan for $604m reservoirs scheme

title: Doha Bank says backing loan for $604m reservoirs scheme
text:
Monday, 10 August 2015 1:58 PM 
(Getty Images - for illustrative purposes only) 
Doha Bank is backing a project financing to be used to construct the 2.2 billion riyal ($604.3 million) Water Security Mega Reservoirs Project for Qatar General Electricity & Water Corporation (KAHRAMAA), the bank has said. 
The deal has been signed with Leighton Contracting Qatar, a unit of United Arab Emirates-based Habtoor Leighton Group, with Doha Bank adding in the bourse filing it had already issued project-related guarantees to the company. 
It did not specify a value for the financing backing the project, nor the terms of the loan. 
The reservoirs in the project, named Rawdat Rashed, have a capacity of 100 million gallons each and will be the largest reinforced concrete reservoirs in the world, the statement said, without mentioning the total capacity of the project.
